alert.note: Alert for Day; Marshall (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued October 30 at 4:46PM MDT until October 30 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: The National Weather Service in Aberdeen has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northern Day County in northeastern South Dakota... Southwestern Marshall County in northeastern South Dakota... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 545 PM CDT, a dangerous snow squall was located 7 miles east of Pierpont, or 8 miles southeast of Langford, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. South Dakota Highway 12 may be affected. Locations impacted include... Webster, Waubay, Langford, Enemy Swim Housing, Roslyn, Pierpont, Newport Colony, Eden, Grenville, Waubay Lake, Minnewasta Lake, Cattail Lake, Blue Dog Lake, Piyas Lake, Waubay Wildlife Rec Area, Fort Sisseton State Park, Amherst, Rush Lake, Pickerel Lake Rec Area, and Bitter Lake. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
